title: Daniel Trabue House
text:
The Daniel Trabue House, at 299 Jamestown St. in <a href="Columbia%2C%20Kentucky">Columbia, Kentucky</a>, was built in 1823. It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1974.
It was home of Daniel Trabue, famous for his early account of life in Kentucky, "<a href="Westward%20into%20Kentucky">Westward into Kentucky</a>".
The original portion of the house was a two-room brick building, with a full attic above, within what is now the southwest corner of the house.
